module.p: cion lack, want, shortage is a masculine, indeclinable common noun.

Examples with a genitive modifier –
cion fala anaemia
cion ùidhe apathy
cion meirbhidh indigestion
gluasad cion earbsa
no confidence motion td. 29
cion-cosnaidh òigridh
youth unemployment td. 29
nochd e cion foighidinn
he showed a lack of patience td. 135
seo cion-fàth an ràdha
this is the reason for the saying td, 135 Is ‘cion-fàth’ a noun compound of ‘cion’ or a compound noun of ‘fàth’?
cion-cnàmh
indigestion td. 135 Is this a noun compound of ‘cion’ or a compound noun of ‘cnàmh’?

Or perhaps a specifier –
cion a’ bhuntàta the potato shortage
tha cion an uisge agus a’ bhidhe ann
there is a lack of water and food td. 135
cf. mo chion ort fhèin my desire for you [Angus Watson The Essential Gaelic-English Dictionary (2001)]
Note that, like dìth need, lack, want, deficiency, deficit, shortage, ruin, cion is not a quantity expression cf. Dh’òl Raonaid cion fìona for Rachel drank too little wine.
